name: Spruce Point Inn Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I saw that this the top rated resort at Boothbay Harbor. What I didn't understand that this is a world-class resort. I mean, they were making S'mores for the kids in a back firepit! Kayaks, sailboat, pool, Oh My. We are definitely coming back a bringing kids and grandkids. Loved this spot
reviews.title: Wow

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The Spruce Point Inn is the perfect location for an authentic Maine experience. The view is amazing (make sure to choose a room with a view), the people (guests and staff) are very friendly and helpful, the Inn is clean and well kept. We went sailing (you can catch the Sarah Mead right at the SPI dock), kayaking (free while staying at the inn), hiking on the grounds, swimming in the salt water pool, enjoyed s'mores every evening and tried our first lobster. All in a weekend. Would definitely return. It's worth the money and the few minutes of additional driving to stay here vs. in town.
reviews.title: Authentic Maine Experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Doing an 11 day road trip of the Northeast and this was the part of our trip that we scheduled to be quiet and relaxing. It was just that! We got in late and it was a nice surprise to find out our room had been upgraded. The check-in lady was very friendly and such a good first impression. The room was big and cozy and we loved the fireplace. Our favorite things: Our room opened to a covered patio with 2 rocking chairs, the bathrobes, the complimentary water at check-in, the room had a Keurig and the bathroom essentials were from Bath and Body Works! The only downside was that we didn't stay long enough to use the amenities of the resort. Can't wait to come back!
reviews.title: Gorgeous and relaxing Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we pulled up to the Inn, we were in love. Clarissa at the front desk was a "doll" she was a wealth of information and had such a winning sense of humor. She made sure each time we saw her that our stay was as we expected and if there was anything she could do for us. She was great!! She even called our room to see how our stay was and if she could be of help. No question we had was unanswered. Andrew, the bell hop/van driver was so sweet and polite. He is a great worker who takes his job to heart. He always took a few minutes in his very busy day to speak to us. Great job Andrew. Capt'n Shawn was wonderful as well. He was a great tour guide when he took to and fro the harbor. Shawn has such wonderful tales to tell and knows so much about the history of the sea...Thanks Capt'n!
reviews.title: Beyond our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled solo
reviews.text: And if that isn't enough, the setting is stunning and the grounds are so pretty and restaurants are terrific. Great food and service. Cant wait to come back next year. I felt spoiled!!
reviews.title: Quintessential Maine resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at Spruce Point Inn.
reviews.title: A Top Spot for BoothBay Harbor with only one caution.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is the best, the hotel and the grounds were all first rate.
reviews.title: Not what I would expect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Sean captained the launch for us as we went into town and he added a short tour guide overview of the harbor and some of the antique sailboats. Just fantastic.
reviews.title: Right out of a movie!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CAUTION NOTE: Most of the old historic resorts, guest lodges and B&B spots in Maine have no air conditoning. This is very common as it goes back to the days before global warming when Maine summers were more moderate.
reviews.title: Great ambience - quesionable service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: If you want A/C accomodations in Maine-ASK ABOUT IT!
reviews.title: Once again, a great July 4th vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very pleasant surprise. This was our very first time here and we will go back. Whenever you see a website you really don't know what to expect but, they delivered. We arrived early and although our room wasn't ready Scott the doorman took us on a tour of the property and explained everything. This turned out to be very helpful. The room was in the Sunset cabin and it was great. No air but it wasn't a problem. Shawn the boat captain was fantastic. We went on a private boat tour of the harbor and what a tour. From top the bottom the Inn was fantastic. Don't forget the SMORES at night and Kayaks! There is plenty of stuff to do on the property. JUST GO!
reviews.title: Great Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So I'm going to rave (rave, rave, rave) about Spruce Point -- but first, my one (and only) complaint. Musak on the Deck -- seemingly 24 hours a day. Really? Here is this totally picturesque and Perfectly Done quintessential Maine oceanfront resort inn and cottages -- something out of a day dream -- and you folks are playing soft rock on the oceanview deck? Let me tell you how much this destroyed my Sunday afternoon nap when all I wanted to do was listen to the seagulls and the wind blowing through the rigging of the flagpole on the front lawn. Just trashed the whole environment... Turn. It. Off. Not to mention, during my three days there, absolutely NO ONE sat on that deck (or even lingered) tapping their toes and saying "oh my how this soft rock really enhances this already magnificent natural beauty." Folks, why?
reviews.title: Spruce Point: The Way a Resort Should Be!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: And I do mean why. Here's what we said about SPI (Spruce Point Inn -- buy the hat, the sweatshirt and the flag if you can -- branding done just right): These folks know their demographic and deliver a seemingly perfect product to them. I grew up on the coast of Maine and I now LONG to spend a week wrapped in the gentle-breezed bosom of SPI. Let the rave begin:
reviews.title: Great Family Vacation in Boothbay Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: 1. Just too adorably picturesque for words, but it isn't overdone! The inn the spruce trees cutouts in the spruce green shutters, the perfectly placed adirondacks, the mix of cabins, paths and oh so well tended but not at all fussy landscaping -- the total package -- feels like a classy oceanfront home tended personally by a staff that loves it even more than you will.
reviews.title: Wonderful Family Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. Gracious, well trained, warm and not overly ingratiating staff. Yup, real Mainahs (well, expect for the imported dining room staff, but they were great and worked so hard for your approval!). Even the maid stopped and had just the "right amount" of conversation with us on the lawn. Well spoken, not fawning -- breeding and manners show. And not at all stuffy! I felt as comfortable with my gay partner as the family with five kids. You are guests at the property and that's how they treat you. Welcome. Just so well done!
reviews.title: Great Stay in Boothbay Harbor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in the Inn (Captain's quarters and Windward Suite) for 3 days in July. The property is stunning, and the views are amazing. We loved our rooms as well. It was beautiful, restful and elegant.
reviews.title: Gorgeous property and location, service needs work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013
reviews.text: We were less pleased with the service. Many employees seems to have a limited grasp of the property or their duties. They often were unable to answer our (pretty basic) questions. At times, some were verging toward impolite.
reviews.title: Top service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We also found the food to be underwhelming in terms of quality, choices and portions. I would recommend eating elsewhere. They charge a lot for fairly mediocre food.
reviews.title: lovely spot, even in the fog!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before I say anything else the location and setting is beautiful. The decor is Maine understated elegance. We had a few glitches during our stay but the front desk manager took care of them promptly with exceptional service. This made our stay very pleasant. The food in the dining room was excellent. It is a nice place to spend a few days and relax. Stay in the old inn building if possible. The views are spectacular. Food is reasonably priced for a resort of this quality. It is however pricey to stay here in the summer. In crowded Boothbay it is the only classic place to stay. There is a shuttle to town by boat and van.
reviews.title: Beautiful Property!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from a long weekend at Spruce Point. This is a fabulous place for families, especially, with many activities and gorgeous grounds. The service was extremely attentive and friendly. Bikes, tennis, kayaks all available as well as the pools, of course. Unfortunately the weather prevented many of these activities but we took a drive to Pemaquid Point and a long visit to Coastal Maine Botanic Garden, both of which were well worth the trip.
reviews.title: Beautiful get away in Maine

description: For more than 100 years, the inn has attracted travelers from across the United States and has provided a refreshing backdrop for families and friends to create delightful memories. Along a stunning stretch of oceanfront on Maine’s rugged coast, the Spruce Point Inn is the premier Maine family resort and an ideal venue for a romantic getaway or for memorable reunions, seaside weddings and business retreats
